content.title: Financial Grant for Reactivation of Mechanised Boats
content.department: Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Grant for Reactivation of Mechanised Boats' is a Sub-Component under the Umbrella Scheme 'Financial Assistance for Availing Subsidy Components for the Development of Marine Fisheries' by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The scheme is introduced with the objective of increasing marine fish production by extending financial grants for the reactivation of wooden/steel mechanized boats.
benefits: Financial grant of ₹10,000 for reactivation of registered wooden/steel mechanized boats
Financial grant of ₹5,000 for reactivation of registered fiber-reinforced plastic mechanized boats
eligibility: Applicant should belong to the fishermen community or be engaged in fishing/fish trade on a full-time basis/prospective entrepreneurs
Must have resided in Puducherry for at least five years
Must be a member of the Fishermen Co-operative Society and aged between 23 and 60 years
Must not be a recipient of Old Age Pension
Must not be employed in Government/Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society
Must not have any dues to the Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies
Must possess a registered mechanized boat
Must have carried out repairs to the engine/hull during the fishing ban period
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the Office/Sub-Office of the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare to request the hard copy of the application form, fill it out, and submit it along with the required documents.
documents_required: Membership Certificate from Fishermen Co-operative Society
Document attesting full-time engagement in fishing or fish trade
Residence Certificate indicating five years in Puducherry
Enrollment certificate as a member of the Fishermen Co-operative Society
Declaration of not being a recipient of Old Age Pension
Declaration of not being employed in Government/Government Undertakings
Proof of possession of a registered mechanized boat
Proof of repairs during the fishing ban period
Declaration/affidavit of not venturing for fishing during the ban

faqs.question: How is the genuineness of applications verified?
faqs.answer: Applications undergo field inquiry by an officer not below the rank of Sub-Inspector of Fisheries, with verification and recommendations by the scheme implementing officer.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on employment for eligible applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, eligible applicants should not be employed in Government, Government Undertakings, or Fishermen Co-operative Society.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Departmental Selection Committee in the selection process?
faqs.answer: The Committee, headed by the Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, is responsible for selecting beneficiaries based on shortlisted eligible applicants.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for shortlisting eligible beneficiaries after field inquiry work commences?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries are shortlisted within 60 days from the commencement of field inquiry work.

faqs.question: Can applicants be above the age of 60 and still qualify?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be below the age of 60 to be eligible.

faqs.question: Can a person engaged in fish trade qualify for subsidies?
faqs.answer: Yes, individuals engaged in fishing or fish trade occupations are eligible.

faqs.question: Can applicants with outstanding dues qualify for subsidies?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must not have any outstanding dues to qualify.

faqs.question: What is the financial grant provided for the reactivation of a registered fiber-reinforced plastic mechanized boat?
faqs.answer: The financial grant is ₹5,000 per boat, subject to revision upon government approval.
